parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have been already, have been previously. From pro and huparcho; to exist before, i.e. to be or do something previously.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Enmity, hostility, alienation. Feminine of echthros; hostility; by implication, a reason for opposition.
